fields.label: Status
fields.name: wcsts_status

fields.label: Priority
fields.name: wcsts_priority

fields.label: Open date
fields.name: wcsts_open_status_date
fields.instructions: If left empty, the system will automatically fill with the "now" date.

fields.label: Closed date
fields.name: wcsts_closed_status_date
fields.instructions: If left empty, the system will automatically fill with the "now" date.

fields.label: Email notification recipients override
fields.name: wcst_notification_recipients_override
fields.instructions:
By default admin email notifications are sent to the site admin email address (or the custom recipients configured on Ticket System Options menu).

To override those settings specify new recipients in the following text area (in case of multiple recipients, separate them by comma). In this way the notifications will be sent only to the following email addresses.

fields.label: Order ticket - Subject type
fields.name: wcsts_order_ticket_subject_type
fields.instructions: Ticket subject can be a text input where the user can type text or can be chosen between a set of topic defined by the admin.

fields.label: Order ticket - Subject topics
fields.name: wcsts_order_ticket_subject_topics

sub_fields.label: Email recipient
sub_fields.name: wcsts_topic_email_recipient
sub_fields.instructions: For each topic you can set specific admin notitifcation recipients (in case of multiple recipients, separate them by comma). In this way the admin notifications will be sent to the specied email addresses. The user notification will be normally sent to the user email address.

fields.label: User ticket - Subject type
fields.name: wcsts_user_ticket_subject_type
fields.instructions: Ticket subject can be a text input where the user can type text or can be chosen between a set of topic defined by the admin.

fields.label: User ticket - Subject topics
fields.name: wcsts_user_ticket_subject_topics

sub_fields.label: Email recipient
sub_fields.name: wcsts_topic_email_recipient
sub_fields.instructions: For each topic you can set specific admin notitifcation recipients (in case of multiple recipients, separate them by comma). In this way the admin notifications will be sent to the specied email addresses. The user notification will be normally sent to the user email address.

fields.label: Automatic ticket - Subject topic
fields.name: wcsts_automatic_ticket_subject_topic
fields.instructions: This is the subject for ticket automatically created when order hits the selected statuses. It works only if the special Automatic ticket option has been enabled.

fields.label: Ticket type
fields.name: wcsts_ticket_type
fields.instructions: Tickets can be Order, User o Pay per ticket type.

fields.label: Associated order
fields.name: wcsts_associated_order

fields.label: Associated user
fields.name: wcsts_associated_user

fields.label: Subject lenght
fields.name: wcsts_subject_lenght
fields.instructions: Max lenght for the Ticket subject.

fields.label: Message maximum length
fields.name: wcsts_message_lenght
fields.instructions: Ticket message lenght.

fields.label: Message minimum length
fields.name: wcsts_message_min_lenght
fields.instructions: Ticket minimum message lenght. Leave 0 for no limit.

fields.label: Select which roles can view tickets in Admin area
fields.name: wcsts_roles_can_manage_ticket_system
fields.instructions: Select which roles can view tickets. If none is select only the Shop Manager and Administrator will be able to manage tickets.

fields.label: Display all tickets to non Administrator users (admin area)
fields.name: wcsts_ticket_visibility
fields.instructions: Choose if in the admin area the non-Administrator accounts can see all the submitted tickets or only the ones assigned by the Administrator(s).

fields.label: Display ticket status on frontend
fields.name: wcsts_display_ticket_status_on_frontend
fields.instructions: By default the ticket status is used only for internal tracking purpose. Optionally you can display ticket current status in the frontend in order to give more feedback to the user.

fields.label: Display ticket priority selector on frontend
fields.name: wcsts_display_ticket_priority_selector_on_frontend
fields.instructions: By default the ticket priority is used only for internal tracking purpose. Optionally you can display ticket status selector in the frontend in order to allow the user to assign a priority to the just created ticket.

fields.label: Enable Tiny mce editor for ticket message area on frontend
fields.name: wcsts_frontend_use_tiny_mce
fields.instructions: This option will enable the Tiny MCE editor for ticket input areas. This will allow your customer to enter a more rich texts.

fields.label: Ticket area pagination
fields.name: wcsts_ticket_area_pagination
fields.instructions: Number of tickets displayed per page in the ticket area.

fields.label: New ticket opening - Time interval before a new ticket can be opened (seconds)
fields.name: wcsts_new_ticket_post_time_interval
fields.instructions: By default, the user can open new tickets without time limitations. Via this option, you can restrict the user to open a new ticket only after X seconds had passed before the last ticket was opened.

fields.label: New message post - Time interval between new posts (seconds)
fields.name: wcsts_new_ticket_message_post_time_interval
fields.instructions: By default, the user can open new ticket messages without time limitations. Via this option, you can restrict the user to post new messages only after X seconds had passed before the last message.

fields.label: User ticket - Display user ticket area in My account page
fields.name: wcsts_display_user_ticket_area_in_my_account_page
fields.instructions: User ticket area can be displayed in My account page in its own tab.

fields.label: User ticket - Disable user ticket opening
fields.name: wcsts_disable_user_ticket_opening
fields.instructions: The user won't be able to open new user tickets. He can only read the already existing and the ones opened by the Admin.

fields.label: User ticket - My Account user ticket area URL endpoint
fields.name: wcsts_user_tickect_area_url_endpoint
fields.instructions: My Account user ticket area by default has the following url: https://youriste.com/my-account/wcsts-user-tickets-area/ . The wcsts-user-tickets-area can be customized using a custom text. If left empty will be used the default wcsts-user-tickets-area endpoint.

fields.label: Order ticket - Enable Order ticket system
fields.name: wcsts_is_order_ticket_enabled
fields.instructions: By default order ticket system is enabled and shows ticket area inside every order details page. Select No to disable order ticket system display.

fields.label: Order ticket - Display "Tickets" column on My Account -> Order table
fields.name: wcsts_display_ticket_number_column_on_my_accont_order_table
fields.instructions: Once enable this option, the plugin will display a new "Tickets" column in the order table reporting the number of ticket opened for each order.

fields.label: Order ticket - Mark ticket as closed on "completed" status
fields.name: wcsts_mark_ticket_as_closed_on_completed
fields.instructions: When an order hits the "completed" status, associated tickets will be marked as closed. Note: switching back the order to another status, won't change the ticket status.

fields.label: Order ticket - Order details area position
fields.name: wcsts_order_ticket_area_position
fields.instructions: Select a position for the Ticket area inside the Order details page

choices.woocommerce_order_details_after_billing_: After customer billing and shipping addresses

fields.label: Order ticket - Disable tickets by order status
fields.name: wcsts_order_ticket_system_disabled_order_statuses
fields.instructions: Select for which order statuses the ticket area will be not displayed in the order details page.

fields.label: Order ticket - Display order status on tickets
fields.name: wcsts_display_order_status_on_order_tickets
fields.instructions: Show order status on order tickets.

fields.label: Order ticket - Number of order tickets that can be opened by user
fields.name: wcsts_order_ticket_limit
fields.instructions: This is the max number of order tickets that the user can open. Set -1 for no limits.

fields.label: User won't be able to reply if ticket is marked as closed
fields.name: wcsts_deny_closed_ticket_reply
fields.instructions: By default user will be able to reply if a ticket was marked as closed. Enable this option to deny user reply for closed tickets

fields.label: Order ticket - Prevent the user to post further messages until an admin posted a reply
fields.name: wcsts_order_ticket_disable_user_reply_until_admin_message
fields.instructions: This option prevents the user to be able to post further messages until he got a reply for the previous one.

fields.label: User ticket - Prevent the user to post further messages until an admin posted a reply
fields.name: wcsts_user_ticket_disable_user_reply_until_admin_message
fields.instructions: This option prevents the user to be able to post further messages until he got a reply for the previous one.

fields.label: Order details page - Disable smooth scroll
fields.name: wcsts_order_details_page_smooth_scroll
fields.instructions: When the Get help button is pressed the user is redirected into the Order details page smoth scolling to the Ticket area. You can disable the smooth scrool feature.

fields.label: Disable "Get help" button
fields.name: wcsts_disable_get_help_button
fields.instructions: On orders list page, for each order, a "Get help" button is displayed. The "Get help" button redirects the user into the order ticket area. This options disable that button display.

fields.label: Ticket messages area - show it already expansed
fields.name: wcsts_ticket_conversation_is_expansed
fields.instructions: By default Ticket message area is collpased. Enable this option to show it expansed.

title: WooCommerce Support Ticket – Text: My Account page user ticket area

fields.label: Tab label
fields.name: wcsts_my_account_page_user_ticket_area_tab_label
fields.instructions: Personal Ticket Area

fields.label: Tab page description
fields.name: wcsts_my_account_tab_page_description
fields.instructions: This is a description displayed in the User ticket area tab page before the ticket area.
fields.default_value: Create a new ticket or reply to the already opened tickets. NOTE: To submit a ticket about an order, please click on Orders tab, click on the order you wish and then use the ticket area you find in the its details page.

fields.label: New ticket description text
fields.name: wcsts_new_ticket_description_text
fields.instructions: This is a description text showed on new ticket area. Here you can provide more info about response time or whatever you think you customers should know before submitting a new ticket.

fields.label: New ticket "succesfully submitted" message
fields.name: wcsts_new_ticket_succesfully_submitted_message
fields.instructions: This is the text message showed after a ticket has been sucesfully submitted.
fields.default_value: The ticket has been succesfully submitted!
fields.placeholder: The ticket has been succesfully submitted!

fields.label: Allow file(s) attachment?
fields.name: wcsts_allow_files_attachment

fields.label: Number of uploadable files
fields.name: wcsts_num_of_uploadable_files

fields.label: Allowed file types
fields.name: wcsts_allowed_file_types
fields.instructions: Specify which file type(s) are allowed. Leave empty to allow all file types. In case of multiple file types, specify extension separating value by comma. Ex.: ".jpg, .pdf, .png".

fields.label: Max file size
fields.name: wcsts_max_file_size
fields.instructions: Specify the max size of the uploadable files. Size is expressed in Kb.

fields.label: Email sender name used for notification emails
fields.name: wcsts_email_sender_name
fields.instructions: Leave empty to use the Blog name as sender name.

fields.label: Pay Per Ticket - No more questions left message
fields.name: wcsts_ppt_no_more_questions_left_message
fields.instructions: This text is displayed on the fronted when the users cannot hasn't left any more question.
fields.default_value: You cannot ask any more question.
fields.placeholder: You cannot ask any more question.

fields.label: Order list page - Get help button text
fields.name: wcsts_get_help_button_text
fields.instructions: Text for the "Get help" button showed in the order list page.

fields.label: Personal Ticket Area tab - new messages counter label
fields.name: wcsts_personal_ticket_area_tab_new_messages_counter_label
fields.instructions:
Every time a new messages are available, this text will be showed notifing the new number of messages. Use the special %s as placeholder for the number of messages.

NOTE: to not display the label, leave empty this field

fields.label: Staff label on admin replies
fields.name: wcsts_staff_label_text
fields.instructions: On admin replies, "Staff" is used as author. You can customize that text by using this option.

title: WooCommerce Support Ticket – Options: Email notifications

fields.label: User - Email notifications
fields.name: wcsts_user_email_notifications
fields.instructions: Enable user email notifications.

fields.label: User - New ticket submission notification
fields.name: wcsts_user_new_ticket_submission_notification
fields.instructions: A notification email will be sent to the user after he has submitted a new ticket.

fields.label: User - Reply by admin notification
fields.name: wcsts_user_reply_by_admin_notification
fields.instructions: A notification email will be sent to the user whenever an admin replies to his ticket.

fields.label: Admin - Email notifications
fields.name: wcsts_admin_email_notifications
fields.instructions: Enable admin email notifications.

fields.label: Admin - New ticket submission notification
fields.name: wcsts_admin_new_ticket_submission_notification
fields.instructions: A notification email will be sent to the admin after an user has submitted a new ticket.

fields.label: Admin -  Reply by user notification
fields.name: wcsts_admin_reply_by_user_notification
fields.instructions: A notification email will be sent to the admin whenever an user replies to his ticket.

fields.label: Custom admin recipients
fields.name: wcsts_admin_custom_email_recipiens
fields.instructions: By default sends admin email notifications to the default WordPress admin email address. You can override this behaviour by specifing one or more email addresses in the following text are. In case of multiple recipients, separate email addresses with commas.

fields.label: Disable email header and footer
fields.name: wcsts_disable_email_header_and_footer
fields.instructions: If you are experiencing any layout issue due to a 3rd party email customizer plugin, try disable the email header and footer rendering.

fields.label: Email from address
fields.name: wcst_email_from_address
fields.instructions: By default as notification from email address will be used noprely@'yourdomain'. You can however customize using this option. Leave empty to use the default one.

title: WooCommerce Support Ticket – Options: Pay per ticket

fields.label: Disable payment detection
fields.name: wcsts_ppt_disable_payment_detection
fields.instructions:
By default Pay Per Tickets will be available only after a payment is detected. In case of a not automatic payment method (like "checks" or "cash on delivery"), WooCommerce considers the payment as perfromed once the checkout is completed. So tickets will be available just after the checkout has been even if they have been actually paid.

Disabling the payment detection will make the Pay Per Tickets available only when the order hits the Completed status (so you can make sure orders have been paid).

title: WooCommerce Support Ticket – Texts: Automatic ticket first message

fields.label: First message
fields.name: wcsts_automatic_ticket_first_message
fields.instructions: When an automatick ticket is opened you can optionally send a first message to the user. Leave empty if you don't want to send any first message.

title: WooCommerce Support Ticket - Texts: emails sent to User

fields.label: User - New ticket email subject (Order ticket type)
fields.name: wcsts_user_new_ticket_subject_text
fields.instructions: This is the subject used for the notification email sent to the user after he has placed a new ticket. You can use the special {ticket_id} to display the ticket id, {subject} to display the ticket subject.

fields.label: User - New ticket email body (Order ticket type)
fields.name: wcsts_user_new_ticket_email_body_message
fields.instructions: This is the email body used for the notification email sent to the user after he has placed a new ticket. You can use the special {order_page_url}, {ticket_id}, {subject} and {message} shotcodes in the message body to embed the ticket details page link, display the ticket id, the ticket subject and the message replied by the admin. You can also use the special shortcode listed here.
fields.default_value: Thank you for contacting us. You ticket has been received, we will contact you back as soon as possible.

fields.label: User - New reply by admin email subject (Order ticket type)
fields.name: wcsts_user_new_reply_by_admin_email_subject_text
fields.instructions: This is the subject used for the notification email sent to the user after an admin has replyed to his ticket. You can use the special {ticket_id} to display the ticket id, {subject} to display the ticket subject..

fields.label: User - New reply by admin email body (Order ticket type)
fields.name: wcsts_user_new_reply_by_admin_email_body
fields.instructions: This is the email body used for the notification email sent to the user after an admin has replied to his ticket. You can use the special {order_page_url}, {ticket_id}, {subject} and {message} shotcodes in the message body to embed the ticket details page link, display the ticket id, the ticket subject and the message replied by the admin. You can also use the special shortcode listed here.

fields.label: User - New ticket email subject (User ticket type)
fields.name: wcsts_user_new_ticket_subject_text_user_type
fields.instructions: This is the subject used for the notification email sent to the user after he has placed a new ticket. You can use the special {ticket_id} to display the ticket id, {subject} to display the ticket subject.

fields.label: User - New ticket email body (User ticket type)
fields.name: wcsts_user_new_ticket_email_body_message_user_type
fields.instructions: This is the email body used for the notification email sent to the user after he has placed a new ticket. You can use the special, {ticket_page_url} (My Account -> User ticket area page), {ticket_id}, {subject} and {message} shotcodes in the message body to embed the ticket details page link, display the ticket id, the ticket subject and the message replied by the admin. You can also use the special shortcode listed here.
fields.default_value: Thank you for contacting us. You ticket has been received, we will contact you back as soon as possible.

fields.label: User - New reply by admin email subject (User ticket type)
fields.name: wcsts_user_new_reply_by_admin_email_subject_text_user_type
fields.instructions: This is the subject used for the notification email sent to the user after an admin has replyed to his ticket. You can use the special {ticket_id}to display the ticket id, {subject} to display the ticket subject.

fields.label: User - New reply by admin email body (User ticket type)
fields.name: wcsts_user_new_reply_by_admin_email_body_user_type
fields.instructions: This is the email body used for the notification email sent to the user after an admin has replied to his ticket. You can use the special {ticket_page_url} (My Account -> User ticket area page), {ticket_id}, {subject} and {message} shotcodes in the message body to embed the ticket details page link, display the ticket id, the ticket subject and the message replied by the admin. You can also use the special shortcode listed here.
fields.default_value: The admin has replied to your ticket: {message}

fields.label: Open automatically a ticket when an order hits a particular status?
fields.name: wcsts_open_ticket_automatically

fields.label: Select for which order status
fields.name: wcsts_automatic_ticket_order_status
fields.instructions: When the order will hit the selected statuses, a ticket will automtaically opened.

fields.label: Enable first message email notification to the user
fields.name: wcsts_automatic_ticket_enable_first_message_notification
fields.instructions: By default, when a ticket has automatically opened no notification is sent. This option will disable the default behavior. NOTE; Make sure you have enabled the User notification options.

title: WooCommerce Support Ticket - Texts: emails sent to Admin

fields.label: Admin - New ticket submitted by user email subject
fields.name: wcsts_admin_new_ticket_subject_text
fields.instructions: This is the subject used for the notification email sent to the admin after an user has submitted a ticket. You can use the special {ticket_id} to display the ticket id, {subject} to display the ticket subject.

fields.label: Admin - New ticket submitted bu user email body
fields.name: wcsts_admin_new_ticket_email_body_message
fields.instructions: This is the email body used for the notification email sent to the user after an admin has replied to his ticket. You can use the special {admin_ticket_page}, {ticket_id}, {subject} and {message} shotcodes in the message body to embed the ticket details page link, display the ticket id, the ticket subject and the message replied by the admin.
fields.default_value:
The user has submitted a new ticket:

Ticket subject

{subject}

Message

{message}
Reply by clicking on the following link: {admin_ticket_page}

fields.label: Admin - New reply by user email subject
fields.name: wcsts_admin_new_reply_by_user_email_subject_text
fields.instructions: This is the subject used for the notification email sent to the admin after an user has replied to a ticket. You can use the special {ticket_id} to display the ticket id, {subject} to display the ticket subject.
fields.default_value: New reply from user to ticket #{ticket_id}

fields.label: Admin - New reply by user email body
fields.name: wcsts_admin_new_reply_by_user_email_body
fields.instructions: This is the email body used for the notification email sent to the user after an admin has replied to his ticket. You can use the special {admin_ticket_page}, {ticket_id}, {subject} and {message} shotcodes in the message body to embed the ticket details page link, display the ticket id, the ticket subject and the message replied by the admin.
fields.default_value:
The user has replied to your ticket:

Ticket subject

{subject}

Message

{message}
Reply by clicking on the following link: {admin_ticket_page}

fields.label: Admin - New ticket assigned email subject
fields.name: wcsts_admin_new_ticket_assigned_email_subject_text
fields.instructions: This is the subject used for the notification email sent to the user to whom has been assigned the ticket. You can use the special {ticket_id} to display the ticket id, {subject} to display the ticket subject.

fields.label: Admin - New ticket assigned email body
fields.name: wcsts_admin_new_ticket_assigned_email_body
fields.instructions: This is the email body used for the notification email sent to the user when a new ticket has been assigned. You can use the special {ticket_id},{admin_ticket_page} shortcodes in the message body to display the ticket id and the ticket details page link.
fields.default_value:
Following tickets have been assigned: {ticket_id}.
Reply by clicking on the following link(s): {admin_ticket_page}
